        Returns:

      • getMessageType

        public MsgType getMessageType()

      • getOptionCount

        public int getOptionCount()
        Returns the number of Option instances contained in the option list. Note that only options with non-default values are contained in the option list.
        Returns:
        the number of options contained in the messages option list

      • getCode

        public Code getCode()
        Returns the message Code (method code for requests, status code for responses or empty)
        Returns:
        the message code

      • getToken

        public byte[] getToken()
        Returns the value of the token option or an empty byte array b with (b.length == 0) == true.
        Returns:
        the value of the messages token option

      • isRequest

        public boolean isRequest()
        Returns true is the message is a request (as indicated by the message code) or false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if message is request, false otherwise

      • setRcptAdress

        public void setRcptAdress(java.net.InetAddress rcptAddress)
        Sets the recipients IP address. Usually there is no need to set this value manually. It is only used to define the default value of the URI host option and is invoked automatically during construction if necessary.
        Parameters:
        rcptAddress - The recipients IP address

      • setMessageID

        public void setMessageID(int messageId)
                  throws InvalidHeaderException
        Sets the message ID for this message. Normally, there is no need to set the message ID manually. It is set or overwritten automatically by the OutgoingMessageReliabilityHandler.
        Parameters:
        messageId - the message ID for the message
        Throws:
        InvalidHeaderException - if the message ID to be set is Invalid

      • setContentType

        public void setContentType(OptionRegistry.MediaType mediaType)
                    throws InvalidOptionException,
                           ToManyOptionsException
        Adds the option representing the content type to the option list. This causes an eventually already contained content type option to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - The media type of the content
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if there is a content type option already contained in the option list.
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding this option would exceed the maximum number of allowed options per message

      • setETAG

        public boolean setETAG(byte[]... etags)
                throws InvalidOptionException,
                       ToManyOptionsException
        Adds an appropriate number of proxy URI options to the list. This causes eventually already contained ETAG options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        etags - The set of ETAGs to be added as options
        Returns:
        true if ETAGs were succesfully set, false if ETAG option is not meaningful with the message code and thus silently ignored
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the options to be added is invalid
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding all ETAG options would exceed the maximum number of options per message

      • setToken

        public void setToken(byte[] token)
              throws InvalidOptionException,
                     ToManyOptionsException
        Adds token option to the option list. This causes eventually already contained token options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        token - the messages token
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if the token does not match the token constraints
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding the token option would exceed the maximum number of options per message.

      • setPayload

        public int setPayload(org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer buf)
               throws MessageDoesNotAllowPayloadException
        Adds the payload to the message. This cause eventually already contained payload to be removed.
        Parameters:
        buf - ChannelBuffer containing the message payload
        Returns:
        the size of the payload as number of bytes
        Throws:
        MessageDoesNotAllowPayloadException - if the messages type does not allow payload

      • setPayload

        public int setPayload(byte[] bytes)
               throws MessageDoesNotAllowPayloadException
        Adds the payload to the message. This cause eventually already contained payload to be removed.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Array of bytes containing the message payload
        Returns:
        the size of the payload as number of bytes
        Throws:
        MessageDoesNotAllowPayloadException - if the messages type does not allow payload

      • getPayload

        public org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer getPayload()
        Returns the messages payload
        Returns:
        the messages payload as ChannelBuffer or null if there is no payload

      • getOptionList

        public OptionList getOptionList()
        Returns the message option list. Note that the option list does only contain options having non-default values. If e.g. the target URI port is 5683 which is the default value, there will be no URI port option contained in the list. Use getOption(OptionName.URI_PORT) to get the actual value.
        Returns:
        the OptionList instance containing all contained with options non-default values

      • getOption

        public java.util.List<Option> getOption(OptionRegistry.OptionName optionName)
        Returns the set of Option instances of the given OptionRegistry.OptionName contained in the messages OptionList or an eventual default value if there is no matching option contained. The set is empty if there is neither an Option instance contained in the OptionList or a default value for the OptionName.
        Parameters:
        optionName - The name of the option to be looked up.
        Returns:
        The set of Option instances for the message matching the given OptionName

      • getHeader

        public Header getHeader()
        Returns the messages header
        Returns:
        the messages header
